content.question: Which of the following gives the best reason why the final mass is less than the mass of the two helium-3 atoms?

choices.label: There was likely a measurement error because this observation violates the law of conservation of mass. This is an example of why the classical theory of conservation of mass had to be replaced by the theory of conservation of mass-energy.
The scientist is not considering the mass of electrons lost to electrical discharge in the reaction. This, therefore, does not challenge any classical theory of physics.
The scientist is not considering the mass of any neutrinos released during the reaction. This, therefore, does not challenge any classical theory of physics.

The reaction converted some of the mass into energy in the form of light. This is an example of why the classical theory of conservation of mass had to be replaced by the theory of conservation of mass-energy.

content.answer: The reaction converted some of the mass into energy in the form of light. This is an example of why the classical theory of conservation of mass had to be replaced by the theory of conservation of mass-energy.
